com.googlecode.jaks.maven

Class AssembleMojo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
      • com.googlecode.jaks.maven.AbstractJaksMojo
        • com.googlecode.jaks.maven.AssembleMojo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.maven.plugin.ContextEnabled, org.apache.maven.plugin.Mojo

    public class AssembleMojo
extends AbstractJaksMojo
    Assemble a Java application into an archive.
    Author:
    Jason Smith

    • Field Detail

      • zipCompression

        protected int zipCompression
        For the ZIP archive (if specified in #atypes, 0 for no compression, 1 for fastest, 9 for smallest. 2 through 8 are a compromise between fastest and smallest.
        Alias: zip-compression
        Default: 1

      • types

        protected List<String> types
        Types of archives to create. Any of zip, tar, tar.gz, tar.bz2.
        Default: ["zip", "tar.gz"]

      • appFolder

        protected File appFolder
        The source application folder. Resources in this folder are added to the assembled archives.
        Alias: zip-compression

      • fileSystemTargetFolder

        protected File fileSystemTargetFolder
        File-system target. The files from the assembly are copied to this location for use in integration testing and development.
        Alias: file-system-target-folder

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssembleMojo

        public AssembleMojo()

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException,
                    org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoFailureException
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException
        org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoFailureException

      • createArchive

        protected File createArchive(Collection<AbstractNode> nodes,
                 String type)
                      throws Exception
        Create an archive from the nodes.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The resources and folders that go into the archive.
        type - The type of archive. One of zip, tar, tar.gz, or tar.bz2.
        Returns:
        The file that was created.
        Throws:
        Exception - See Exception.
